content.raw: It is not necessary. I thought it was new rule for inherited comment. I saw this way of comment before at other header files of gazebo in some commits. Somehow there is only one line in [MeshShape.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/8b2d9259f8d0607f2cbeaf470e9349bbe4efa8c1/gazebo/physics/MeshShape.hh?at=default#cl-53) now.
content.html: It is not necessary. I thought it was new rule for inherited comment. I saw this way of comment before at other header files of gazebo in some commits. Somehow there is only one line in MeshShape.hh now.

content.html: I don't know. @jlee02 ?

content.raw: abab4a64ceee
content.html: abab4a64ceee

update.description:
[DART 4.0 has been released](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0). It improves support for universal and screw joints (partial fixes to #1096, #1011), joint springs (partial fix for #975) and complete fixes for #910, #1079, #1174.

DART 4.0 has a lot of API changes, so merging this pull request will make DART 4.0 the minimum required version. There is a minor ABI breakage in DARTLink.hh, but I have targeted this to the gazebo_3.1 branch since we have not yet released any debian packages that link against dart. If people think this is a bad idea, I will re-target to default.

To test, you can build dart from source (use [v4.0 tag](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/releases/tag/v4.0) or [release-4.0 branch](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/tree/release-4.0)) or install libdart-core4-dev from the dartsim ppa (also requires libccd and fcl):
~~~
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:libccd-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:fcl-debs
sudo apt-add-repository ppa:dartsim
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libdart-core4-dev
~~~

I still need to update the homebrew formula.
update.title: DART 4.0 support

content.raw: abab4a64ceee
content.html: abab4a64ceee

content.raw: Yeah. I just don't want to make any exceptions to the rule.
content.html: Yeah. I just don't want to make any exceptions to the rule.

content.raw:
Just to clarify, even though we haven't released debian packages that link against dart, we should still preserve ABI?

EDIT: I mean to say I don't know of any existing libraries whose ABI could be broken.
content.html:
Just to clarify, even though we haven't released debian packages that link against dart, we should still preserve ABI?

EDIT: I mean to say I don't know of any existing libraries whose ABI could be broken.

content.raw: Please retarget to default if there is an ABI breakage.
content.html: Please retarget to default if there is an ABI breakage.

content.raw: From what I gather, the `SpawnDropCoGOffset` failure is due to use of mesh collision geometry, but why is `DropStuff` failing? Is DART not simulating inelastic collision here?
content.html: From what I gather, the SpawnDropCoGOffset failure is due to use of mesh collision geometry, but why is DropStuff failing? Is DART not simulating inelastic collision here?

content.raw: Is `copydoc` necessary? doxygen defaults with `INHERIT_DOCS` set to yes.
content.html: Is copydoc necessary? doxygen defaults with INHERIT_DOCS set to yes.

content.raw: If `_index == 1`, could the joint force limits be computed using thread pitch?
content.html: If _index == 1, could the joint force limits be computed using thread pitch?

content.raw: should `GetThreadPitch` return the thread pitch regardless of index given? (as long as it's less than number of dofs)?
content.html: should GetThreadPitch return the thread pitch regardless of index given? (as long as it's less than number of dofs)?

content.raw: minor:  `if (_index < this->GetAngleCount())`?
content.html: minor: if (_index < this->GetAngleCount())?

content.raw: minor formatting stuff: 4 space indents as opposed to 2 elsewhere.
content.html: minor formatting stuff: 4 space indents as opposed to 2 elsewhere.

content.raw: Should switch all instances of `std::cout` to `gzdbg` or other gazebo console output helper functions.
content.html: Should switch all instances of std::cout to gzdbg or other gazebo console output helper functions.

DART 4.0 has a lot of API changes, so merging this pull request will make DART 4.0 the minimum required version.
